name: ProMaster Eyelash Curler
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Always curl lashes before applying mascara..-Open eyes wide to insert and center lashes..-With curler pad placed at base of lash line, hold handles firmly and gently squeeze..-Hold for a few seconds, then open curler slowly to release lashes..-Repeat up the length of lash from base to tip for an even more intense curl..-Clean pads after use with alcohol wipe. .-With daily use, we recommend replacing curler pad after three months and curler after one year.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I have possibly the most stubborn lashes I've ever come across. They're relatively long, but so straight that they point downward and impair my vision if I don't curl them and wear waterproof mascara (regular won't keep them up). My eyes are also downturned and hooded, so it's difficult to get a lash curler to curl all of the lashes, especially at the outer corners where it seems I always have 3 or 4 lashes that poke out/ that I can't get. This lash curler is meant for those hooded eyes, those annoying straight lashes. It probably won't make a difference if you naturally have pretty ok lashes, but for us that struggle, this one does it for me. It is able to reach every lash, curl them without a strong crimp line, clipping my lid, or drooping throughout the day. My outer corner lashes NEVER curl, but this lash curler made it happen. Expensive for a lash curler, but I'm beyond happy with it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone
reviews.review_text: I finally found an eyelash curler that actually fits my eyes!! I don't have almond shaped eyes but I do have very, very deep set eyes - I tried the Shu Uemura curlers (s-curler and original) both failed to get into my eye socket properly and didn't curl. I always thought I'd never find the right curler. I've been struggling with my Cleanlogic one for years and never thought I could get a better one suited to my eye. The photo is the Cleanlogic vs Tweezerman - look at the difference of how much of my lashes it grabs. Amazing!!

I bought this after I purchased the disappointingly pinchy Kevyn Aucoin eyelash curler and the great Sephora collection Utowa one. I love both the Tweezerman Pro and the Sephora one. Both are perfect for my almond shaped eyes and fits other eye shapes (mom approved). In a way, I feel like it's easier to get every lash curled with the Sephora one without fail, but the Tweezerman Pro does the same when placed correctly and it comes with more replacement pads (3 versus the 2 from Sephora). I love both and I'm keeping both. I recommend this product as it delivers on its promise that it's perfect for almond shaped eyes (me) and deep set eyes (mom with aging lids). No pinching! Hooray!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone
reviews.review_text: ATTENTION ASIANS! If you have almond shaped eyes, straight af lashes and you've tried every other lash curler on the market, pick this up ASAP. I've tried shu uemura, shiseido, lancome, tarte, surratt, drugstore, sephora brand, and none of them worked well enough for me. The Shiseido one came close for a while but it could never curl the ends of my lashline properly. I was tired of buying and exchanging curlers all the time.  THEN I PICKED THIS UP. It's easy to use and gives my lashes a nice, even curl everywhere. My hunt is finally over god bless! An even better bonus is that it comes with 2 extra pads.

This curler requires you to use A LOT of pressure in order to get any type of curl. While pressing down, my hand slipped and I ripped out about 35 lashes, leaving a big bald spot on the outer corner of my left eye. I wish I had returned it right when I tried it. I have never had to push down this much with other curlers.
I love this lash curler. It's been hard to find a lash curler for my eye shape and size and this is amazing. It curl wonderfully and works great. Absolutely love it

I love this lash curler. I own several Tarte lash curlers but those never last long. It would only last several months. I'm so happy I found this one. It curls my poker straight Asian lashes. I bought it March of last year it's still going strong. I might buy another one as a backup.

I bought this based on the reviews and I was a little skeptical because I felt like an eyelash curler is an eyelash curler. This definitely made me change my mind. It's great for my Asian ladies and anyone with almond shaped eyes. I know I sound like a record player when I say this but, no pinching! Worth my $$
